inn1.comm: nice and tight as he homes in on back of a length just outside off, Shehzad keeps to his disciplines as well and presents a straight bat
jags back in off the seam as he pitches just short of a good length, Shehzad refuses to play because it began outside off
strays in line as this inswinger nips down leg. Shehzad shuffled across to tickle it away, but doesn't succeed
pins him to the crease with another back of a length delivery on off stump, Shehzad stayed inside the line and gets a bit of a thick outside edge to point
doesn't adjust to the left-hander as he fires it full and on Sharjeel's pads, pushed down to mid-on
thumped, but straight to point. A little short and a little width, Sharjeel stands up tall and taps it atop its bounce but doesn't fine the gap
ends the over with a good length ball on middle and leg to keep the batsman honest
loosener to start, at 129 kph, Shehzad gets back and across and whips a shortish ball off his hips to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, better line makes Shehzad trust a straighter bat to mid-off
goes a touch fuller and a shade outside off, Shehzad shoulders arms.
that's the line where his awayswing will pose problems. Targets off stump and Shehzad counters it this time by getting back and across with a dead bat
pushes him back with a shorter delivery, Shehzad defends
that should have been punished. Malinga is barely clocking 130 kph and this was short and wide too, but Shehzad, despite getting into a decent position, mistimes his cut
absolutely no footwork for Sharjeel and he is quite lucky to survive the transgression. This was on a good length and ducked back in off the seam. Missed off stump by a whisker
fullish on off stump, gets forward this time and drives to mid-off

he has not been keen to get forward, too early in his innings perhaps and that becomes his undoing. Thick outside edge flies to second slip! Good length ball goes on with the angle across the left-hander, he helps Prasad by staying stuck on the crease and reaching with his hands. Tame push, nick produced, catch pouched
tests his backfoot play as he bangs the ball in short, Hafeez uses his full height to bunt it down
no early jitters for Hafeez as he leans forward to a fuller ball and drives crisply into the covers
excellent use of length from Prasand. Gets the ball to nibble just enough to take the outside edge as Hafeez is squared up on the back foot.
fuller and gets a little shape away outside off, Hafeez is happy to leave
oh, that's lovely! He is trying to get his pace up as well but more than that he struck a good length and weaved the ball away past the outside edge of a prodding Hafeez

more uncertainty as Malinga employs the awayswinger again, teasing outside the off stump. Hafeez wants to feel bat on ball and chases it. Beaten, no matter if he tried to pull the bat away at the last minute
targets middle and off, not as much movement this time, Hafeez gets behind it
fuller on middle and jerking away from the bat, Hafeez defends from the crease to the covers. Pace hovering around the low 130kph
back of a length on off stump, Hafeez gets back to block
shortish but sliding down leg, Shehzad wanted to glance it away but it was too far from him
finds a good length, but he went fishing a little too far outside off to interest the batsman
full and outside off, Shehzad gets forward and leans into a cover drive but didn't time it quite as well as he'd like
keeps bringing him forward and Shehzad pushes back to mid-off
good length ball around the sixth stump, Shehzad opens the face and defends into the off side
tries to force the issue as he gets back and thumps a shortish ball, but straight into the off-side ring
fuller and outside off, Shehzad gets stuck in the crease in his attempt to hit the ball hard. Gets only an inside edge onto the pad
fuller on off stump, with that nagging shape away. Hafeez has to respect it and it's another dot ball
good length and moving away outside off, Hafeez has spotted it and lets it go
walks at him, but Malinga doesn't like that. Feigns a throw after fielding the front-foot push off a good length ball on off stump
full on leg stump, Hafeez shuffles across to whip it away but gets struck on the pads. Sri Lanka go for an unconvincing appeal. Would have slid down leg

races down the pitch and heaves a good length ball over the off side. That was Shehzad seeking release and he finds it, even if it didn't go off the middle. Prasanna hurtles after it from point and dived perhaps too early to rein it in
back of a length and outside off, Shehzad dabs it to deep third man
outside edge again, but it doesn't carry to the two slips! This was back of a length and in the off stump corridor, Shehzad does shuffle across but not enough and the poke is worse.
frustration is getting to the batsmen. This was on a good length outside off, Shehzad throws his bat and it and enjoys a leading edge the flies over square on the off side
fuller on off stump, Shehzad taps it down to mid-off

that's the pressure talking! And some might argue Pakistan have placed it on themselves, to an extent. Drags a good length ball, with no feet, right into the hands of mid-on. Too early to be manufacturing strokes, especially against the bowler who has looked most likely to pick up wickets
makes him reach out to a good length ball outside off, Misbah defends into the off side
back of a length and straightening off the deck, Misbah was shuffling across to try and defend on top of the bounce but is beaten
full on off stump, at 127 kph, Hafeez nudges to mid-on
good length a shade outside off, Hafeez lets it go

huuuuge appeal for lbw and finally the umpire is persuaded. But the batsman is not. Goes for a review straight away. Pitched on a good length and nibbled in just enough, Hafeez was flicking across the line and misses. It's a marginal call, and the ball tracker says it would have clipped leg stump to it stays with umpires call. Review lost, top order all but silenced
hoped to greet him with a yorker, but it ends up a little too full. Fawad closes the face and gets a leading edge to a low full toss to point
hurried Fawad there as the indipper skids off the deck. Fawad was stuck in the crease and sought for a flick across the line, misses and wears it on the thigh
this one may have stayed low! Fawad in the middle of a muddle, but is just able to protect his stumps with the bottom of his bat
that could be a useful way back, tickling singles into the leg side and using the right-left combination to upset the bowlers
shortish on middle and leg, Fawad works it towards midwicket for a quick single
fuller and outside off, Misbah gets forward and plays a lovely drive to cover
good length in the channel, Misbah intercepts it with a straight and docile bat
ducked back in at him from back of a length, Misbah didn't expect it to move so much but soft hands and an alert partner allows him to get off strike
full on off stump, Fawad attempts a dab but gets a bit of leading edge into into the point region
fuller on middle, Misbah nudges in front of midwicket and races across to the other end
bowls it fuller on off stump, Fawad shuffled across to get in line and turns it towards short midwicket. Goes on the bounce to that man.
opts for the short ball, a little leg sidish though as Fawad ducks under it
goes for the blockhole, but misses it by a couple of inches. Fawad works it to the left of mid-on
full and curling away outside off at 130kph, Misbah pushes into the covers. He's bowling well within himself for whatever reason
back of a good length at 131 kph, defended solidly by Misbah
flays at a wide delivery, which was at 137 kph, enjoys a thick under edge that flies away past the outstretched hand of the second slip
targets the stumps this time and Fawad tickles it to midwicket. The umpire adds the Prasad has overstepped. Searching for that extra yard of pace. Free hit time

143kph, wanted to do all he could to keep the runs down and cranked his pace up. It was a fuller length as well, but Misbah was happy on his back foot, on off stump, and went for an almighty slog. Gets an outside edge that races past the keeper's right. Wry smile on Misbah's face
good length ball strays down leg, he's been very good with his lengths but has compensated his lines for pace sometimes
good length ball outside off, Misbah reaches forward and blocks with soft hands and an open face. Didn't intend for the ball to go so fine but he gets a boundary through third man
banged in short of a length and outside off, Misbah gets up on his back foot and rode it to deep third man again
back of a good length on off stump, Fawad tries to tap and run on the off stump but doesn't succeed in placing the ball well enough
turns a good length ball off his middle stump towards midwicket
full and nipping in on middle and leg, Misbah pushes to mid-on
good length ball just outside off stump, Misbah allows it to pass
fuller and a shade outside off, Misbah gets forward to block
good length just outside off, Misbah shaped to play but thought better of it
goes short this time and Misbah has been watchful enough to rock back and pull strongly to deep midwicket. A little more oomph on that ball from Mathews too
teases Fawad outside the off stump, but the good length ball is left alone
tossed up on off stump, Misbah eases it back to the bowler
perhaps a little less flight than the last ball, but it hits the same spot angled in on middle. Misbah stays beside it and blocks
flatter and pushed through on leg stump, Misbah presents a straight bat
flighted up on middle and off, Misbah plonks his bat in front of pad
defends the good length ball on off stump with soft hands and Fawad drags his captain along for a quick single. Good work

misjudged the line a bit as Herath goes around the wicket, flighted ball on middle and off stump is met with a sweep but Fawad was jerking his eyes off the ball worried that he hadn't reached the pitch of the ball
good length ball on off stump, Fawad gets across and uses his wrists to tickle the ball to long leg.
back of a length and outside off, Misbah does not play at it
fuller and outside off, Misbah lunges forward to block
good length ball on off stump, tapped into the covers and Fawad, as ever, is awake for a quick single. By the way, the sun's broken through again
and keeps him in play with a bouncer that gets enough lift to make Fawad duck under it
ran at Mathews with great intent, but the bowler switches up with a short ball. Fawad gets into a pull but isn't quick enough with it to time it well. I wonder if it's drinks, yep seems to be
flighted on off stump, defended
slower through the air, Misbah gets under it and slog sweeps to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump, Fawad looked to close the face and pick a single to the leg side but Herath bowled it too slow and drew an outside edge
tossed up on off stump, Misbah defended into the off side
flighted on middle, Fawad lunges into a sweep and keeps it along the turf to deep fine leg
gets into a shot too early and adjusts his push into the off side, Came forward to block but they can't sneak the single
waits on it a little better, and it was shorter outside off too, tapped behind point
full and outside off, Misbah steers it off the front foot to deep third man
full and outside off, Fawad shuffles across and pushes to the right of cover, who dives after the ball but doesn't quite pull it back

thats a direct hit and Misbah has just kept on going. he knows he's short! Just when they were getting to safer ground, Misbah has underestimated Dilshan's prowess at point. Raced in, got a good bounce into his right hand and sent a dead-eye through that capitalised on just the smallest hesitation
cranks it up at 137kph, according to the speed gun. It's shortish on off stump. Fawad pulls but gets an inside edge onto his hips
fuller on off stump, Akmal keeps to his crease and blocks
gets forward to a good length ball and blocks solidly
fuller and a touch wider of off stump, not bothered with
good length and outside off, he's bowling as fast as Malinga did earlier in the day, 130kph, left alone again
full and a few inches outside off, Akmal taps it back at the bowler
beaten! This straightened off a good length outside off, Akmal flashed at it and doesn't connect
rolls his fingers on a fuller ball, Fawad is awake to the offcutter and taps into the covers. Not seeking that single this time
back of a length on middle, Fawad punches to point
fuller and outside off, Fawad opened the face and steered it to point again
pulls his length back and allows Fawad to tuck it away to the left of mid-on, that's a well-judged single
that's short again, and whenever he opts for that change in length, he hikes his pace. This was at 134 kph. Akmal has to get up off his toes to absorb the bounce and produce a single to midwicket
good length ball targeting off stump, defended
thump and Akmal brings the fifty up in style! Length ball, picked up and pummeled over where wide long-on might have been. Good productive shot!

but it's gone into his head! This was quicker, shorter rising almost above his head outside off. Took it on unwisely, gets a top edge and Malinga runs up and to his right from mid-on, tumbles and takes a pretty good catch
shortish and outside off, Maqsood defends with an open face into the point region
shortish on middle and leg, Maqsood gets up on his toes and drops it in front of midwicket. Excellent single
back of a good length and it thuds high on the bat, enough to make Fawad lose control of the bat as he defends into the leg side. Thisara's enjoying himself after taking 100 ODI wickets
picked away off his pads to deep fine leg
good length outside off, Fawad defends solidly
tapped down to mid-off as he gets back to a short of a good length ball outside off
banged in short, but Fawad exhibits better technique as he keeps the ball down and pulls to deep midwicket
shortish and probing outside off, tapped into the hands of point
closer to off stump and Fawad has to adjust from his cut to a punch off the back foot
slower and fuller outside off, Fawad steers it to deep point
full on off stump, Fawad taps it back down the pitch but Thisara doesn't get down quick enough. They run off a misfield, but end up safely
back of a length and around off stump, turned away to midwicket
banged in short and that rises considerably high! 134 kph, sails over the batsman's left shoulder. Maqsood takes evasive action, but had to do it quite late. Didn't expect it to get that high
that is magnificent! Took it on the up and smacked it through extra cover. Full face of the bat stings down on the ball and it simply skids away off the turf
shortish on off stump, Maqsood is better prepared as he rides the bounce and turns a single behind square leg
shortish and outside off, bunted away to the sweeper on the off side
nicely tossed up on off stump, Fawad keeps it out
bit of turn, bit of bounce and Fawad defends outside the line and is surprised by the help Prasanna gets. Hit rather high on the pad
nice flight on middle and leg, Fawad defends with a closed face
outside edge, but the deflection is too big for the keeper. This one seemed to go on with the arm. Fawad was plying for the turn though and enjoys a bit of luck
pushed through on middle and off, Fawad drops it at his feet
hint of turn in, but it was pitched short of a length and Fawad is comfortably behind it
back of a length and outside off, Maqsood doesn't bother with it
gets forward to a good length ball and guides it to the sweeper.
shortish and rising towards the chest, Fawad jumps up and works it behind square leg

that's another beauty from Thisara! Dun in sharply, there's too much bounce for Maqsood, the last time that happened he managed to get himself out of the way. This time he fends and gloves it to the keeper. Terrific take behind the stumps as Sanga dives to his left
good length ball on off stump, defended confidently
back of a length and outside off, watches it sail through to the keeper
tossed up on off stump and pushed back at the bowler
slower though the air as he flights it on off stump, defended with soft hands
a little too much flight there and Fawad flicks it on the full to long-on

he's hammered it through the covers, there was a man close in and he dives to his right, frantically trying to make something out of nothing. It was Dilshan, he had already done that once before but this was struck too hard

too much intent, of the needless kind. He danced down the track, opened the face to scythe it over point. Made a little too much room to enable the stroke, but worse, there is a sweeper in place, he has to run a little to his right and picks up a reverse cup to send Prasanna on a lap!
flighted on off stump, defended calmly
banged in short again, Fawad isn't too shy of taking it on. Uses his wrists to keep it down but doesn't time it

there's another. It's a procession! No more reviews left, and Wahab is not pleased with the outcome, wanted a second opinion but is surprised to see he can't go for it, Dilshan pats him on the back to send him on his way. Its the bounce again, coupled with a little nip away. The batsman chased it with an open face, although we can't conclusively say there was an edge, but the keeper went up, the bowler went up and so did the finger
shortish on off stump, Ajmal jumps back and defends into the leg side.
banged in a little too short and the umpire says that's over head high
good length ball just outside off, poked into the covers
backed away and cuts from the stumps but can't get it past point. Sri Lanka have turned up for his decider, Pakistan not so much
flicks a short of a good length ball off his pads through midwicket
flighted on the stumps, Fawad plonks his bat in front of pad
jumps down the track to heave a flighted ball down the ground. Again, didn't time it as well as he would prefer
tossed up on middle, Fawad eases it through the square leg region
flighted and drifting down leg, Ajmal was working it away with the turn into the leg side. That was the googly but he misses it
flighted on middle and leg, Ajmal keeps it out
tossed up on middle and leg, defended
steered to point with an open face
good length ball on and around off stump, Fawad taps it down the ground for a quick single
hits a good length just outside off, Ajmal steps forward to block
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
that was short, he's had success with that length, but Ajmal has managed to pull it right over the keeper's head. More of a top edge, even if he was trying to place it fine
much more confident with the pull as he finds deep fine leg
flighted outside off, Ajmal gets forward to drive back at Prasanna
looped up on middle, Ajmal defends
gets to the pitch and pushes towards mid-on, but short midwicket comes in handy
teasing flight again on off stump, Ajmal pushes to the left of the bowler
gets forward to block a fuller ball with an open face
pulls his length back and makes Ajmal use the angled blade as he gets a little bit of turn
short and wide, Fawad cuts strongly to the sweeper

bounced out again! Pretty much a replay of Akmal's wicket, perhaps this was a touch slower but he had to drag the bouncer from outside off stump again, poorly judged pull lands in the hands of midwicket. Dolly of a catch

ohhh, he might be seven foot tall but the bouncer still worries him. Fends it away towards gully, but there isn't one. Has a jaunt out of his crease and could well have been run out had that hit. Fawad has another animated conversation with Irfan from the other end
banged in short but this time he stays inside the line and leaves
goes for the wide yorker, ends up a full toss and he doesn't poke
back of a length and outside off, not by much, but Irfan refuses to play. Looks like Fawad has got through to him
walks at him but Thisara makes him think twice with another good bouncer. Irfan fends it away, amazingly off the front foot. That was coming at his head
offcutter pushed full and outside off, Fawad lunges forward and almost sweeps to mid-on
another slower ball, this time on a length outside off. Fawad backs away and thumps it to the covers
full on off stump, at 124 kph, Fawad clears his front leg and scoops it on the bounce to extra cover
106 kph, that time his radar goes awfully wrong. Don't see that often with Malinga, even with his variations. Slower ball goes too far outside off
beats him with another slower ball, it was full and a shade outside off. Fawad looks to slice it through point and misses
backs away and taps a good length ball to extra cover. Fawad wanted a single but Irfan says no. Fawad is miffed
slices a slower delivery wide of off stump through to deep third man
still can't pierce the gap in the covers. Fawad had timed it better, he had made room to a shortish ball on the stumps and thumped it
backs away again and rides the bounce on a back of a length delivery through the covers. Doesn't take the single though
that's smart! Realised Thisara is working enough pace to take advantage of and he sways his torson inside the line and guides it past the keeper's dive to the third man boundary
jumps down the track and swipes at a shortish ball outside off to mid-on

fuller and outside off, driven into the covers. The fielder hopes to catch Irfan napping at the nonstrikers' but he seems safe. Didn't slide the bat in which was why the fielder went for it. In the end it ends up an overthrow
fuller and outside off, Irfan stays put and fishes outside off to no avail
sees the batsman making room and offers a slower ball outside off, the offcutter beats him easily
cramps him for room this time on middle and leg, Fawad had hoped for a couple but it's not quite forthcoming. Irfan has to tackle four balls from Malinga
there's the yorker that was always coming. Send down with almost pin-point precision but Irfan managed to get his bat down just in time to get a fortuitous inside edge
this is a good length delivery probing away outside off, Irfan pokes and misses
that was competently defended through the covers, scurries off to the other end after picking the gap in front of point
low full toss on middle, picked away to short midwicket. Irfan will have to take strike for the next over
not quite! This was flighted on off stump, Irfan went for a slog sweep but the ball swooped under his bat and rattles his stumps. Fawad stands there, stunned at this collapse for a few moments.

inn2.comm: slides a back of a length delivery down the leg side. Sri Lank off the mark without breaking a sweat, story off the match so far
133 kph, gets his line right and has Tharanga in trouble. Reared up and sailed past the outside edge as the batsman pokes from the crease

cramped up on middle and leg this time, Tharanga does not like the pace and bounce that Irfan is getting. Seeks a leg bye but it would've been unwise with Afridi coming in front short square leg to flick a back of the hand underarm to hit the target
short and rising on off stump, Tharanga is squared up as he blocks and gets an outside edge to safety at the nonstrikers' end
while at the other end Dilshan hammers a pull to the square boundary with consummate authority. Swiveled on the back foot, got on top of the bounce and rolled his wrists to keep the ball down.
back of a length and steered across the right-hander at 137 kph, left alone wisely
veers his torso away to try and get a shortish delivery up and over the cordon, but doesn't succeed.
tucks a shortish ball off his stomach with a closed face and picks up a single behind square leg
another pull another four. Sri Lanka aren't going to be lagging on their feet. Got on the front foot and smoked a shortish ball almost in front of midwicket
drilled this into the pitch and that gives the ball all the momentum it needs to sail over the off side ring and skip off to the extra cover boundary. Ferocious striking, like the Dilshan of old
140kph, doesn't quite time this shortish ball outside off, looked to flay it in front of point but mistimes it to the fielder instead.

banged in short, but too far down the leg side. Dilshan loads up for another pull, wanted to hit the fine leg boundary, be he can't reach that far. Akmal can though, terrific take behind the stumps as he dives full length to his left
back of a length on and around off stump, defended
pierced the gap between cover and mid-off. Stood up tall to get on top of the bounce and drilled it off the back foot. Wahab's lengths are causing Pakistan major problems
fuller on middle and leg, drilled down the ground. This is the length he likes and he takes advantage of it. Beats mid-on on his right handsomely

this looks close! Direct hit from Fawad and Dilshan, though he's grounded his bat, seems dicey. Tharanga was again in considerable discomfort when the ball is shortish at the body. Seems to have gotten and inside edge onto his pad and they go for a risky single. Could have gone either way but Dilshan stretched just enough
back of a length and outside off stump, sails through to the keeper
full on middle and leg, flicked away in front of square leg
a little room there for him steer a back cut to deep third man
good length ball on and around off stump, Dilshan swipes it towards midwicket
138 kph, length ball on leg stump. Dilshan looked to pick it away to the fine leg boundary but it brushes his pad through to the keeper. Uproarious appeal, for no use
shortish on middle and off, Dilshan keeps to his crease and nudges to short leg

another call for lbw from Wahab as he strikes Dilshan on the back thigh. The batsman was going for a pull, but the ball scuttled lower than he thought. The umpire reckons it's fine, but Misbah wants a referral. And it seems to be wasted because the ball was pitched outside leg
hits on the up to short cover as Wahab bowls a good length outside off
shortish on middle, Dilshan got into the flick a little too quickly and misses.
not quite short enough to go for the pull, but Dilshan has just looked in that mood today. Gets an inside edge onto his back thigh this time but Wahab still goes for a hugely optimistic appeal
dabs at a short of a good length ball outside off, can't beat point
full and wide outside off, Tharanga unleashes a square drive that just skims off the turf. Magnificent stroke
good length ball on middle, Tharanga defends with a closed face and gets a bit of a leading edge
good length ball on leg stump, Tharanga nudges towards midwicket and sets off. The fielder rushes up, swivels around to throw at the nonstrikers' but misses
just short of a good length on leg stump, Dilshan looked to work it through square leg but wears it on the pads
short and outside off, Tharanga lets it sail past harmlessly
length ball with ample width, Dilshan needs no further invitation and carves it over covers. Violent stroke
shortish on middle and leg, worked away towards square leg
fuller and angled in on leg stump, Tharanga tries to work it off the pads. Does so, but there's no wood on it
targeting on the pads, Dilshan looks to flick but the bat doesn't make contact
shortish and rising on middle, Tharanga gets up on his toes to bunt it down
banged in short and outside off, too much height to go for the horizontal-bat shot. Tharanga, unlike Pakistan's batsmen, weaves away
the lines have not been proper at all this innings. Shortish and on the pads, Dilshan enjoys a deflection off the thigh to the fine leg boundary
good length ball pushing away outside off, Dilshan steers it past point
fullish with a little bit on nip in at Dilshan, works it away to midwicket and the umpire decides to give Irfan his first warning for running down the pitch
fullish on middle and slanting in, Dilshan meets it with an angled bat and scurries along to the other end as mid-off comes up to field
shortish and outside off, Tharanga defends off his back foot

leans into a cover drive, only he ends up inside edging onto middle stump! Invitingly full, even if that doesn't seem Irfan's natural length, it was wide enough to chase but the batsmen mistimed it. Good way to go to the break for Pakistan
fullish and a shade outside off, Dilshan pushes to mid-on
on a good length just outside off, Dilshan taps to mid-on softer and races across to the other end
144 kph, umpire rules dead ball because Sanga shaped to pull but then decided to leave. The short ball angled in at the body brushes off him to the fine leg boundary
banged in again, but this time Sanga is more authoritative with his decision making. Pulls to ground behind square leg
back of a length on middle, Dilshan gets in line with it
fuler delivery on middle and leg, Dilshan pushes to mid-on and sets off. Soft hands again and mid-on is put under enough pressure to misfield
gets the good length ball to shape back in, Dilshan has to ensure he doesn't get his front leg in the way. Tucked away to square leg
flashes at a fuller, wider ball and gets a thick outside edge that skitters away to the third man boundary. Fifty for Sri Lanka
that's where he gets the ball to misbehave. Pitched back of a length and it it reared up off the track to beat the outside edge of Dilshan's poke.
stays a touch shortish, but this time the ball keeps lower than Dilshan anticipates. Goes for a front-foot pull but fails to connect
he's been off and on with the pull today, this short ball strikes him on the stomach as he was shaping for the shot. Beaten by the lack of pace in that ball

there were two slips in place, he didn't really have too much room to exploit and it was that uncertain shortish length again. But Dilshan stayed still and tapped the ball on top of its bounce and found the third man boundary. Lovely stroke
fuller on off stump, Sangakkara works it away through midwicket
short ball, at 144 kph, Dilshan is quicker on the pull this time. Absorbs the pace, rolls his wrists and guides it to deep fine leg
back of a length on off stump, Sanga gets up on his toes to block

he's got him! Lovely delivery, lured the batsman on the drive and the outside edge is safely pouched at second slip. Wahab is pumped as he gets the ball to shape away late just enough to fox Sanga. The bat pushed in front of him and away from his body, hitting on the up, and perishes
shot! That is sheer class from Mahela. It was overpitched, it was wide, it was begging to be clattered to the boundary but Mahela calmly granted its wish with a caress through  the covers
shortish on the pads at 141kph, Mahela shuffles across inside the line and glances it to deep fine leg
banged it and it lifts high enough to beat Dilshan's hook, it was also down the leg side though
just short of a good length on off stump, Dilshan inches forward though to defend
short again and Dilshan has not been shy of taking it on, pulled to deep fine leg
gets back, rises up on his toes and defends the shortish ball on off stump with soft hands
back of a length and a shade outside off, Mahela shuffles in line and guides it towards point
not quite so pretty that time as he is hurried by a short ball. It was rearing towards his throat, Mahela protected it with his gloves but the ball ballooned into no man's land in front of the slips
shortish on off stump, that time Mahela has an answer to the extra bounce
flighted on middle, Dilshan likes that line and flicks to deep fine leg
gets forward on off stump so that he can play with the turn through midwicket
tossed up on off stump and the change in line forces Dilshan to defend
hurries down the track, but Ajmal's dip foils the intent. Defends into the off side
flighted on middle, Dilshan flicks to square leg
had the batsman in a muddle and Dilshan finally reads it off the pitch. Was stuck on the crease as Ajmal pulled his length back. Worked away safely enough behind square leg
shortish and outside off, Mahela uses the width and chops it through point. Didn't look to hit the ball too hard, just tapped it and used his wrists to get the power he needs
shortish and rising towards his armpits, Mahela has managed to get up on his toes and whip it to deep fine leg
opts for the short ball again, Dilshan is quick on the pull again. This one goes up, no roll of the wrists, but it fall short of the man at deep fine leg
fullish on middle, Mahela's wrists sends the ball on a path behind square leg

fullish and fired in full outside off, Dilshan looks to slap it down the ground but mistimes it. Irfan leaps up, how tall does he get, 10 feet? Flings down a throw to get the batsman hurrying back in his crease
good length ball steered across the right-hander, left alone
tossed up but on leg stump, it's been worked away through midwicket
brings down an angled bat to meet a flighted ball that was tailing on leg stump. Single to long-off
waits on a flighted delivery just outside off and defends with soft hands
gets across in front of his stumps and flicks to square leg
strays in line again and Mahela works it through midwicket
dropped gets down the pitch and looks to shovel a drive back down the ground. It was hit hard, but Ajmal dived to his right, got two hands to it but could not hold on. Not at all pleased with himself
141 kph, sails over the batsman's head and that means the umpire gets some exercise. This pitch has offered good bounce all through the day, sometimes disconcertingly
sat up for the pull and Mahela obliges as he puts away a short ball on middle stump, rather thoroughly done
switches around the wicket now but still keeps Mahela on the back foot, tucked away with soft hands into the leg side and they snare a quick single despite Wahab's direct hit at the nonstrikers'
retures back over and fires it full and wide outside off, Dilshan throws his arms at it and gets a thick outside edge that races to the third man boundary
shortish and skidding on middle, Dilshan pulls along the ground behind square leg
good length ball angled in at off stump as Wahab moves back around the wicket. Defended stoutly
keeps to his crease and whips a shortish ball with the angle through square leg
flighted just outside off, Mahela goes for a reverse sweep and hits it onto his pads. Ajmal hasn't spotted it and goes up in appeal
flighted on middle and leg and turned further
good length ball, tapped away to square leg
tossed up on off stump, carefully defended
inches forward and waits for the ball to dip on him before turning it towards midwicket
that's the straighter one, lobbed up on off stump but Mahela's picked it and blocks
another one that doesn't turn, loads of flight on it as Mahela turns it into the on side
short and wide, Mahela chops it to the sweeper

oh dear! That skidded on quickly and were it not for Dilshan's quick hands, that could have posed serious threat to off stump. Rocked back to cut but has to settle for a single into the covers in the end
stays back as he guides a shortish ball through to cover
flighted on off stump, defended
tossed up outside off, eased to mid-off
on a length and Mahela has caressed it through the gap in the covers for a lovely couple of runs
drifting down the leg side and Dilshan's swept it quite well, got on top of it and finds a single to deep fine leg
slower and tossed up on middle and off stump, worked away into the midwicket region
turned through straight midwicket as Mahela leans forward to the pitch of a flighted ball on middle and leg
skips down the pitch, got a little too close as he heaves to deep midwicket

one run left to win, and Mahela has tapped a doosra to first slip. It went a touch wrong too, a shorter ball outside off and turning further away. He had misread the turn, was originally looking to play it but after he read off the pitch, he thought of pulling away. But wasn't quick enough. Slip does extremely well to grab that. Dilshan has an almost apologetic smile on his face
flighted on leg stump, Mathews tucks it to midwicket
backs away to a good length ball and slaps to point

beats point on his left and Dilsha raises his fifty and the victory. It was short and wide again, he backed away, waited a little longer and hammered it past the fielder's reach. Quite a comprehensive ending to a game the hosts have dominated throughout
